summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorneys regarding a logistical request from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel. The defense requested to pick up and hand-deliver a new drive containing discovery materials to Maxwell at the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) so she could review them over the weekend, as she had been unable to view the previously provided CD.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated defendant whose defense counsel is requesting to hand-deliver discovery materials to her at the MDC so she can review them over the weekend.

events.title: Request to Hand-Deliver Discovery to Maxwell
events.description: The defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell requests permission to pick up a new drive containing discovery materials from the U.S. Attorney's office and hand-deliver it to Maxwell at the MDC so she can review the materials over the coming weekend.

locations: Southern District of New York, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) as of January 2021.
Maxwell's defense counsel was actively preparing for her legal defense by requesting discovery materials.
There was a logistical issue where Maxwell could not view discovery materials previously provided on a CD, necessitating a new drive.
The U.S. Attorney's Office was coordinating with defense counsel to facilitate Maxwell's access to discovery materials over a weekend.
The correspondence shows procedural cooperation between the prosecution and defense regarding evidence handling during Maxwell's pre-trial detention.
